pipes correctly. So, long command lines with pipes should be
converted to a single command, eg:

/bin/sh -c 'echo command | tee /etc/file'

on the every next boot after the first boot.

subject: Dell Storage Center: Add retries to API calls
commit_message:
Dell Storage Center: Add retries to API calls

In heavily loaded networks we have seen some cases
of temporary ConnectionErrors when making REST API
calls. There are usually successful calls just prior
and immediately after these failures, so it appears
to be a transient condition.

This patch utilizes the recently merged retry decorator
to add some retry handling to the REST API calls when
this condition is encountered.

With a test script looping through repeatedly running
CI against this first patch I was able to validate
that it addresses the issue. Out of 20 runs, a full
2/3 of the tests passed showing that the retry was
used. These test runs would have failed without the
retry.

The output from these test runs can be viewed here:

http://oslogs.compellent.com/?C=N;O=D

Pertinent results are dell-sc-iscsi-1554792015-12*

Once merged we should be able to enable full third

subject: Add the 'version' column to the compute_nodes table.
commit_message:
Add the 'version' column to the compute_nodes table.

WIP - do not merge until spec is approved.

When installations of OpenStack are upgraded, it is common to update
compute nodes individually instead of all at once. Some of the changes
that will be coming later in the patch series will require the scheduler
to be able to distinguish between older compute nodes and those updated
with at least the Kilo version of the code. During the mid-cycle, the
consensus was to add a column to the compute_nodes table that would be
populated by the compute node upon startup with its current software
version. Discussion on the spec for this settled on a string column that
would default to '0', but would be populated by the current RPC version
that the compute node supported. This way future updates to the compute
node software could require a higher minimum version for changes made in
order to be sure that the nodes would work correctly with it.

subject: Use canonical MySQL root pwd reset procedure
commit_message:
Use canonical MySQL root pwd reset procedure

Current Implementation:
Trove restores InnoDB backups by operating directly on the file system.
This means that the restored database would still use
the old (and potentially no longer available) root password.
Trove therefore needs to reset the password on the restored databases.
This was originally done by starting the service in the
safe mode (which allows root login without password) and
executing 'SET PASSWORD FOR ...' statement to reset the password.

Proposed Improved Solution:
The recommended generic procedure for resetting a 'forgotten' root
password is documented in the official MySQL doc:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/resetting-permissions.html

Added '--skip-grant-tables' to 'mysqld_safe' startup parameters.
That is required for unrestricted access to the user table.
The server can be instructed to start using grant tables at any
time by executing 'FLUSH PRIVILEGES' statement.
Added '--skip-networking' to prevent anybody from sneaking in
across the network while resetting the root password.
Replaced the password-reset statement with a direct user table update
followed by 'FLUSH PRIVILEGES'.
Removed '--protocol' parameter from the mysqladmin shutdown call,
as we started the database with '--skip-networking' and the guestagent
is running locally anyways.
We also check for errors in the password-reset stage,
so that a proper error message (including cause) can be logged.

Tested with MySQL  5.5/5.6 and Percona

Closes-Bug: 1419995

The resize code in the driver is problematic. This stems
from the fact that a clone of the VM takes place. There are
a number of know issues with this:
1. resize selects an invalid datastore (bug 1407438)

   1407050)
3. resized instances are not marked as owned by OpenStack on the
   VC (bug 1402784)

In fact we could do the resize on the existing VM. This has the
following advantages:
1. it does not need an additional VM
2. it fixes the bugs that are mentioned above
3. It is now far simpler and more robust
4. It does not require convoluted instance naming and tracking
5. VM deletion is simple
6. enables better test covergae

The patch makes use of the same VM for resizing.

specific to the old resize.

subject: Setup br-tun in secure fail mode to avoid broadcast storms
commit_message:
Setup br-tun in secure fail mode to avoid broadcast storms

When not creating br-tun in secure fail mode, there are chances to
get a broadcast storm from br-tun.

For example, this occurs when at least three nodes have the br-tun
OpenFlow rules reset in and a broadcast/multicast packet enters br-tun.

This can happen if:
  * openvswitch is restarted, until the agent reloads the Openflow rules.
  * during neutron-openvswitch-agent restart, br-tun is reset, and there
is a few seconds timeframe where tunnel endpoints are plugged and OF
rules are reset.

Secure fail mode doesn't forward traffic by default if no rule is hit.

subject: Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.
commit_message:
Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.

Recently a new package fence-agents-all (version 4.0.7) has been added
to the OSCI yum repo. This package provides and obsoletes fence-agents
version <= 3.1.13. Due to a poor integration of puppet with package
management tools installing fence-agents with puppet fails:

Debug: Package[fence-agents](provider=yum): Ensuring => latest
Debug: Executing '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install fence-agents'
Debug: Executing '/bin/rpm -q fence-agents --nosignature --nodigest --qf %{NAME} %|EPOCH?{%{EPOCH}}:{0}| %{VERSION} %{RELEASE} %{ARCH} :DESC: %%{SUMMARY}\n'
Error: Could not update: Could not find package fence-agents

puppet does not try to figure out if fence-agents is provided by some
other package and query the status of that package, hence the error.
As a work around update the manifests to require fence-agents-all package.
A proper way to solve the problem is to fix dependencies of the packages
(if cobbler needs fence-agents it should depend on it so yum picks a proper
version of fence-agents without any tricks in manifests).

Closes-Bug: #1419889
Change-Id: I208e187def737d05d033e95f34ae5ca58ece9bd0

subject: Add horizon.cookies.getRaw to access raw cookie values
commit_message:
Add horizon.cookies.getRaw to access raw cookie values

Since porting to ngCookie's $cookieStore, horizon.cookies supports
values of type object. In order to implement this, all values are
stored in their JSON representations. This however removes the ability
to read values set by the backend, since horizon.cookies.get attempts
to deserialize the cookie value assuming it is stored in JSON.

This change implements an additional utility method to access raw
cookie values instead of modifying horizon.get to be more adaptive
to non-JSON values, because that would mean the statement
horizon.put('keyBackend', horizon.get('keyBackend')) yields unequal
before and after values when accessing cookies set by the backend.
Moreover, horizon.cookies.getRaw helps developers to be more mindful
of accessing cookie values set outside of the Horizon frontend.
